paragraphs.text: I blame capitalism.
paragraphs.name: 462f

paragraphs.text: And, there’s no diet for this demographic because there is no market for this diet. People generally don’t try to lose weight until they need to lose a lot of weight, and we have a lot of cultural barriers in place to keep it this way. If you’re just trying to lose a little weight, you will often encounter a fair amount of resistance from well meaning people who tell you that you’re not fat, and that you just shouldn’t worry about it. I remember getting weighed at the doctor once, and being asked “how is this weight for you?” and I said “it’s a few pounds heavier than I’d ideally like.” My doctor then said “that’s not much. I wouldn’t worry about it.” And I didn’t. But now, here I am a few years later, and I’m few more pounds heavier than I’d really like.
paragraphs.name: fc05

paragraphs.text: But, all of our cultural baggage around weight makes it really difficult to engage with weight management in a healthy way. End of the day, you’ll probably have to “be a lamp unto yourself” because there exist no culturally available examples of people managing their weight well.
paragraphs.name: 3c60

397b139d8da1.title: Personally, I think “dieting” is a bad idea, ineffective and mostly self-defeating.

paragraphs.text: Personally, I think “dieting” is a bad idea, ineffective and mostly self-defeating. The best advice I ever read about eating (as opposed to “dieting”) is from Michael Pollan: “Eat food. Not too much. Mostly plants.”
paragraphs.name: ac55

paragraphs.text: I don’t blame capitalism 😉
paragraphs.name: c295

paragraphs.text: I blame the fact that a lot of us are operating under a “crisis mentality”. We tend not to deal with something until we have to.
paragraphs.name: 1f2d

paragraphs.text: It shows a lack of discipline in a lot of our behaviors, the fact that we don’t develop good habits that will benefit us and those around us.
paragraphs.name: f1f0

To be honest, yours sounded a lot like a self-motivating piece of writing (which is absolutely fine, by the way).
